title: How can a person mentally heal from any narcissistic abuse? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have a number of ways Including finding professional help and going no contact first of all.While I was healing I identified a number of healing techniques some of them were simple, like walking in the woods, and some of them were spiritual like meditation or yoga, and some of them helped to clear the energy from my body of the negativity from the relationship and the ensuing anxiety that I felt. I’ve listed them elsewhere but I’ll just say that some of them for me were paying attention to my cat, mindfulness, exercise, taking frequent showers and letting go of all the negativity down the drain, self-care, various ways of showing self-love such as taking myself out to dinner, having treats at home, doing something nice for myself like a pedicure or massage, and to get all your emotions out, the love letter technique that I mentioned in my work which is listed under my profile,Is based on John Gray’s book which helps you get out all the emotions and you list everything you’re angry about, everything you’re sad about, basically you just go through the whole relationship and list everything that you’re upset about. It’s very cathartic. I also used the tapping technique or emotional freedom technique which helped me with insomnia, pain, and anxiety.I have a number of such healing techniques and they worked for me.

education. education. education. watch narc videos. read about narc abuse and narc tactics. read and watch about trauma bonds and Stockholm Syndrome. narc victims dont understand whats going on bc we dont see things the way narcs do. they need alot of understanding of how it works. they need to know what abuse is, and how it works.  education is the only way through this. the more you understand then you'll be able to understand that its not your fault they abused you. the number 1 thing a narc does is invalidate a person by blaming the victim for everything that goes wrong. youll come to understand that you are not wrong and you are worth alot more than they made you out to be. narcs treat people like absolute garbage for no reason at all. this is why its really hard to learn that its not the victims fault at all. i learned that a “relationship” with a narc is doomed regardless if you were evil or a saint. they destroy everything and blame everybody else for it.

Sam, hi again. Read all my posts and I will get back to you tomorrow because I am busy healing right now. Listening to music and zoning out. Hugs Ari ❤️🤗😉🙏 Narc abuse sucks. I have to replenish myself. He and the kids are sucking the life out of me.i honestly do not have the time to sit here and answer every question. I care. But the narc keeps buzzing around and the kids are up my a$$ 24 hours a day. 🙄😳shoot me.

I would suggest seeking out a therapist specializing in NPD to help you navigate this and rebuild your self esteem. You can also check out Melanie Tonia Evans on fb, and/or Thriver tv on youtube, who offers free videos and blogs on spotting, dealing with and healing from narcissistic abuse. She also offers a healing program and has recently released a book.
